intro: Ruschia diutina, commonly known as the everlasting flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming throughout the year. Its succulent leaves are fleshy and store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. Ruschia diutina is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its long-lasting blooms and low maintenance requirements.
